message.content:
cs.DC, cs.CR, cs.Distributed, cs.NI, cs.SY. 

The paper proposes a new BFT consensus mechanism that enables a large number of nodes to participate in the consensus process and supports high transaction throughput. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Distributed Computing (cs.DC) sub-category. The paper also discusses the use of a non-interactive leaderless BLS signature aggregation scheme, which is a cryptographic primitive that falls under the Cryptography (cs.CR) sub-category. Additionally, the paper analyzes the efficiency of the proposed protocol, which suggests that it could also belong to the Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-category. The paper also discusses the correctness of the protocol, which suggests that it could belong to the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category. Overall, the most likely sub-categories are cs.DC, cs.CR, and cs.Distributed, followed by cs.NI and cs.SY.
